articles.title: Vegetarian women have 33 per cent higher risk of breaking a hip
articles.description: A large study tracking women in the UK finds that vegetarians have a higher risk of breaking a hip compared with women who eat any amount of meat
articles.content:
By Clare Wilson
Vegetarian diets tend to include less calcium and vitamin B12, which are important for bone health
Facinadora/Alamy Stock Photo

articles.title: Half of Buenos Aires’s methane emissions may come from one landfill
articles.description: Around of a fifth of global methane emissions come from rotting landfills. Satellites have now spotted some particularly large emitters
articles.content:
By James Dinneen
A landfill in Buenos Aires, Argentina
Juan Ignacio Roncoroni/EPA-EFE/Shutterstock

articles.title: Langya virus: How serious is the new pathogen discovered in China?
articles.description: Thirty five people are known to have been infected by Langya henipavirus in the Shandong and Henan provinces of China between December 2018 and May 2021

By Jason Arunn Murugesu
Shrews are thought to be the natural reservoir for a newly discovered pathogen called Langya henipavirus

articles.title: Shredded dwarf galaxies may lack dark matter to hold them together
articles.description: Many dwarf galaxies torn up by the gravity of nearby objects seem not to have any dark matter, which doesn't line up with our understanding of the universe – but they may be explained by a controversial alternate model of gravity
articles.content:
By Leah Crane
A galaxy located in the Fornax Cluster about 60 million light years away
UPI/Alamy
A nearby galaxy cluster called the Fornax Cluster is ripping apart its dwarf galaxies. They appear … [+388 chars]

articles.title: Big Tech and Civil War enthusiasts clash over historic US battlefields
articles.description: Northern Virginia is home to many American Civil War battlefield sites as well as the largest concentration of data centres in the world. Plans for more data centres are now pitting preservationists and big technology companies against each other
articles.content:
By Jeremy Hsu
The first major battle of the American Civil War happened in Manassas, Virginia
Joe Benning/Alamy

articles.title: Sponges can ‘sneeze’ and other sea creatures eat their mucus
articles.description: Despite having no nerves or muscles, sea sponges slowly contract to squeeze sand and debris out of the openings they feed through
articles.content:
By Christa Lesté-Lasserre
Sea sponges “sneeze” in slow motion to get rid of the sand and pollutants that they suck into their bodies, and the expelled mucus may be an important food source for other… [+2986 chars]

articles.title: Roasting green chillies in the sun could pave way for solar cooking
articles.description: An experiment using solar concentrators, which focus sunlight at a point, to roast green chillies suggests it may be possible to build portable solar cookers

articles.title: Underwater robot scans seabed to seek out the most harmful pollution
articles.description: A robot equipped with AI image recognition can identify and map rubbish on the seafloor to help prioritise clean-up operations towards the most toxic materials

articles.title: Giant yellow crustacean in an aquarium turns out to be new species
articles.description: A new species of creamy-yellow isopod was hiding in plain sight in Japan’s Enoshima Aquarium. It was first found in the Gulf of Mexico and mistaken for another species.

Bathynomus yucatanensis is one of nearly two dozen known giant isopod species found in the deep sea.
